intro: Ledermanniella ntemensis, commonly known as the Cameroon moss, is a rare and specialized liverwort found primarily in the tropical rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, leafy structure and intricate thallus morphology. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on decaying wood or rocky surfaces. Its reproductive structures, including male and female gametophytes, are well-developed, contributing to its reproductive strategy in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited research, it remains a poorly understood species within the liverwort family.
